dc:description:
The *SLC34A1* gene is located on chromosome 5 at q35.3 and encodes the Solute Carrier Family 34 Member 1. 

Multiple disease entities have been reported in association with this gene. Per criteria outlined by the ClinGen Lumping and Splitting Working Group, there was evidence of differences in their molecular mechanism, inheritance pattern and phenotypic spectrum. Therefore, Fanconi renotubular syndrome 2 (OMIM:613388) has been split from the following disease entities,
Hypercalcemia, infantile, 2 (OMIM: 616963), and Nephrolithiasis/osteoporosis, hypophosphatemic, 1 (OMIM:612286). The lumped disease entity for autosomal recessive hypercalcemia, infantile, 2 and autosomal dominant nephrolithiasis/osteoporosis, hypophosphatemic, 1 has been curated separately.

*SLC34A1* was first reported in relation to autosomal recessive Fanconi renotubular syndrome 2 in 2010 (Magen et al., PMID: 20335586). The mechanism of pathogenicity is reported to be loss of function. Fanconi renotubular syndrome is a renal disorder resulting from decreased solute and water reabsorption in the proximal tubule of the kidney. 

Only one variant (in-frame duplication) has been reported in one proband in one publication (PMID: 20335586, included in this curation). A total of 0.5/12 pts. for genetic evidence was reached considering case-level data.
There is very little evidence supporting this gene-disease association beyond the expression of SLC34A1 in the brush border of proximal tubule cells in humans (PMID: 8327470). A total of 0.5/6 pts. for experimental evidence was reached.

In summary, the evidence supporting the relationship between *SLC34A1* and autosomal recessive Fanconi renotubular syndrome 2 has been disputed and no valid evidence remains to support the claim. More evidence is needed to either support or entirely refute the role SLC34A1 plays in this disease.
curationReasonDescription: The gene-disease relationship has not been replicated and there is not compelling genetic evidence. Additionally there is no convincing experimental data available.

evidence.rdfs:label: Patient III-5
evidence.detectionMethod: Standard techniques for DNA extraction, single-nucleotide-polymorphism microarray-based genomewide scanning, fine mapping, logarithm-of-odds score calculation, SLC34A1 sequence analysis in the affected persons and their unaffected family members, and mutation screening in a panel of DNA samples from healthy control subjects from the same population group.

evidence.dc:description: Due to the homozygous, consanguineous kindred, this variant was only scored at 0.5 points for the functional evidence.

Phosphate-induced currents produced by X. laevis oocytes showed close to zero currents produced by the variant transcript compared to WT. EGFP-tagged WT protein was localized to the plasma membrane, as evidenced by colocalization with actin. In contrast, EGFP-tagged variant protein was not localized to the plasma membrane but rather accumulated in the cytoplasm.
SLC34A1 is highly expressed at the brush border of proximal tubule cells in humans.
evidence.rdfs:label: Kidney Expression
